definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: May I withdraw money against the letter of credit here?
sentences.chinese: 这个信用证在这儿能取钱吗？

sentences.english: Often , the swindlers scam by trading on people"s greed."
sentences.chinese: 骗子往往利用人的贪欲骗取钱财。

sentences.english: Second is the actor regards defrauding of the wealth as object.
sentences.chinese: 第二，行为人以骗取钱财为目的。

sentences.english: Do you need money because you've overspent on luxury items recently?
sentences.chinese: 你之所以取钱是否是因为最近花了太多钱购买奢侈品？

sentences.english: May I draw money with the credit card here?
sentences.chinese: 我可以用这份信用证取钱吗？

sentences.english: Rather than get money in such a dishonest way, he would beg in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 他宁可沿街乞讨，也不愿意用欺诈手段骗取钱财。

sentences.english: It takes the money right out of your account, so you don't need your chequebook .
sentences.chinese: 这能从你的帐户上取钱，不需要存款本。

sentences.english: Miss Zhao went to the ATM with her bank card.
sentences.chinese: 赵女士持银行卡到银行自助柜员机前准备取钱。

sentences.english: Users can withdraw money, procedures are similar to GAF.
sentences.chinese: 用户可以取钱，程序功能大体相似。

sentences.english: Do you know if they accept credit cards?
The swindlers always make the use of people's greed to get money.
sentences.chinese: 骗子往往利用人的贪欲骗取钱财。

sentences.english: I'd like to withdraw money froom this card.
Deceivers use people's greed to cheat them of their money and property.
sentences.chinese: 骗子往往利用人的贪欲骗取钱财。

definition: to withdraw money from a bank
to use a credit card (or swipe card, smart card etc)
to transfer (money to a bank account)
